title: THE CASE OF THE LAB WITH LEGAL ISSUES
description: Next, the Investigation Institute sent Deductive Logico to a literal mad scientist's laboratory. To clarify, the scientist wasn't crazy: he was furious. His assistant had been killed, and his research had stalled.

suspects.name: VICE PRESIDENT MAUVE
suspects.description: A vice president of TekCo Futures. If she asks you to step into her metaverse, get out now!

suspects.name: PRINCIPAL APPLEGREEN
suspects.description: A strict principal about everything except getting away with murder. His hands are always covered in chalk.

suspects.name: CAPTAIN SLATE
suspects.description: A real-life astronaut. The first woman to travel around the dark side of the moon, and also the first to be suspected of murdering her copilot.

weapons.name: A BRAIN IN A JAR
weapons.description: The worst part is, it's oozing everywhere.

weapons.name: A GIANT MAGNET
weapons.description: Keep it away from any fillings. It generates a powerful electromagnetic field.

weapons.name: A SOUP LADLE
weapons.description: Even a mad scientist loves soup. Particularly tomato bisque.

locations.name: THE ROOFTOP
locations.description: A giant lightning rod is connected to millions of loose wires.

locations.name: THE GIANT LEVER
locations.description: All mad scientist laboratories have a giant lever you can flip from "OFF" to "ON."

locations.name: THE OPERATING TABLE
locations.description: Leather straps could restrain a person here, or a monster.

clues: The shortest suspect was seen hanging around beneath a sign that says "OFF."
Vice President Mauve never got near the operating table.

statements.speaker: Vice President Mauve
statements.statement: Captain Slate brought a giant magnet.

statements.speaker: Principal Applegreen
statements.statement: A brain in a jar was not on the rooftop.

statements.speaker: Captain Slate
statements.statement: It's as clear as the moon: Principal Applegreen brought a brain in a jar.
